snippet.textDisplay:
There is a difference between saying "I have no opinion" and "I don't believe in it" and "I believe it's not true". I don't believe in it might mean that you find the narrative and evidence shown to you to be unconvincing. As a member of the public you don't have an epistemic justification and perhaps you believe others also don't, and yet others hold the belief. That can be not having an opinion + not being convinced by what's been said, and perhaps that's what she's trying to say. But it is not the same as saying that it's false or there is no evidence. I think this middle position is extremely important because often people will talk about the issues as if you have to believe the experts or shut up.

People need to make a distinction between the facts and the justifications for believing the facts. It is possible to disbelieve in the given justifications while believing or suspending belief about the facts.
snippet.textOriginal:

That can be not having an opinion + not being convinced by what's been said, and perhaps that's what she's trying to say. But it is not the same as saying that it's false or there is no evidence. I think this middle position is extremely important because often people will talk about the issues as if you have to believe the experts or shut up.

People need to make a distinction between the facts and the justifications for believing the facts. It is possible to disbelieve in the given justifications while believing or suspending belief about the facts.

snippet.textDisplay: @Nick Harrison  You seem to be missing common sense. I look around the earth and all I see is evidence for a God. I have never seen humans or "nature" create everything here. Furthermore I've still not heard an explanation for what animates us, I'm referring to our Souls. Your body isn't keeping you alive. When you die it's still here but whatever animates you is gone. Science hasn't come close to explaining that or anything related to creation. All we have is a half baked theory about a rock exploding for no apparent reason and voila! All of creation right after. But a 5th grader could tell you explosions don't create they destroy. I don't need Rheems of data to tell me that. Look around, I dare you to explain why we are the perfect distance from the sun, if we were 1/2 mile closer we'd all burn up and if we were 1/2 mile further away we'd all freeze. How does that not point to a creator. It takes more faith to believe the crap pushed in science than to say there's a creator. I don't have that kind of faith.

snippet.textDisplay: Ninety-one out of 100 scientists "agree" when you silence and blackball the ones who don't.  Whether or not anthropogenic global cooling, global warming,  climate change, or whatever they're calling it this time around,  is or isn't a real thing,  the measures being proposed by groups like the nice people an the WEF, ...as well as the usual suspects, (globalists), to "save the world",  are unrealistic and impractical at best, and at worst seem like convenient excuses to extract wealth from everyone not in their little club.   Among other unrealistic things, they want to tax cow farts and to convince everyone that eating bugs, (among other wacky things) is the way to save the world, (which, btw, they are trying to convince everyone that the world is going to die within ten years if we don't all switch to electric vehicles and power everything on wind and solar.)  The one little detail that seems to be overlooked by those trying to force electric vehicles on everyone is;  what do you think is used to charge the batteries on electric vehicles.  You think the electric grid is being strained now?  Hehe...   I think I'll wait until battery tech advances by A LOT,  then maybe I'll revisit the electric vehicle subject.   Even then, all those vehicles need to be charged somehow,  which will GREATLY increase the energy needed to power civilization.   Another thing to consider is that several similar, "scientific", predictions have been made in the past and they were either flat out wrong, or somewhat, "correct", but not enough to be considered significant.

Whether or not anthropogenic global cooling, global warming,  climate change, or whatever they're calling it this time around,  is or isn't a real thing,  the measures being proposed by groups like the nice people an the WEF, ...as well as the usual suspects, (globalists), to "save the world",  are unrealistic and impractical at best, and at worst seem like convenient excuses to extract wealth from everyone not in their little club.   Among other unrealistic things, they want to tax cow farts and to convince everyone that eating bugs, (among other wacky things) is the way to save the world, (which, btw, they are trying to convince everyone that the world is going to die within ten years if we don't all switch to electric vehicles and power everything on wind and solar.)  The one little detail that seems to be overlooked by those trying to force electric vehicles on everyone is;  what do you think is used to charge the batteries on electric vehicles.  You think the electric grid is being strained now?  Hehe...   I think I'll wait until battery tech advances by A LOT,  then maybe I'll revisit the electric vehicle subject.   Even then, all those vehicles need to be charged somehow,  which will GREATLY increase the energy needed to power civilization.   Another thing to consider is that several similar, "scientific", predictions have been made in the past and they were either flat out wrong, or somewhat, "correct", but not enough to be considered significant.

snippet.textDisplay: I do believe that we can affect the climate but i don’t think that Joe’s argument was correct. Back in the day a bunch of medical experts were saying that smoking isn’t bad for you but we see how true that turned out to be. People when asked if they believe in God answer yes or no, not, I don’t know. What do you mean, I don’t know? Either you do or you don’t. It be a different question if asked, do you know if God exist? Then, you can say that you don’t know. People don’t believe that we landed on the moon even tho we have a bunch evidence about it, Joe might have that belief. So, it isn’t wrong to say that you don’t believe in something even tho others say that they have evidence of it. Knowing and believing are two different things, God and religion are a prime example. I don’t believe in God but billions of people do even tho the scientific evidence that there isn’t one are overwhelming. Can’t say why they chose to be brainwashed but believing is their choice and right.

snippet.textDisplay: I think the scientists that disagree with the FEAR Propagandists push should be listened to.  It is an extremely difficult subject.  But climate control crazies  HAVE NO ABSOLUTE ANSWERS. The policies that they are pushing will kill us faster than our planet will.  Already, this is proven in Sri Lanka, where environmentalists believe the fertilizers they were using are bad for our planet.  Now they aren't growing enough to feed their own country,, because organic farming cannot grow  FAST enough to feed the multitude.  The scientists who agree with the narrative pushed by politicians ARE THE ONES THAT GET THE FUNDING FROM THE POLITICIANS.    One of thescientists that i have listened to studied 14 or more weather models that they fed factual information into weather models, trying to hit an exact weather condition that ACTUALLY happened.  Not one of those models came even close to hitting the target they were trying to achieve.  I can't remember his name but I think it was professor Patrick Moore or Dr. John Chrissy.  Anyway I believe there is a warming trend, but we can adapt by being more inventive.....using coal and oil in colder weather, and electric in warmer weather.  And why not use nuclear too,  the Frech are.  Why does everything have to be either/or.  Give up our way of life and  everything that makes us comfortable  and we will be  pushed  into 3rd world status.  Already we are being pushed into SCHEDULED BLACKOUTS,  do you really think this is good for humanity.  Many of us have meds at home that require refrigeration.  We need some common sense leaders.  Let us use ALL ways to keep a balance of CO2, which I have heard that zero emissions of C02 is suicidal.  STOP WITH THE FEAR MONGERING, AND LET US LEARN TO BE MORE INNOVATIVE ON HOW TO HANDLE THIS SITUATION.  we will have the time, let's get it right.  PANIC MODE IS A TERRIBLE TIME TO COME UP WITH ANSWERS....like taking away our natural gas stoves.  An all electric grid cannot handle all the changes our leaders want us to live by.

snippet.textDisplay:
To understand Climate Change, one needs to first understand what causes Climate Change.

They say it’s because of CO2. But, all first graders are all taught that plants need CO2 to survive. Plants take this CO2 and converts it into Oxygen! If you stop CO2, you cancel the production of Oxygen!

Second, one needs to understand how the moon effects out oceans. We all know that the moon causes high tides and low tides. The moon gravity, pulls on our oceans causing these changes.

Next. The Sun is moving in space at 537, 000 Miles Per Hour! Here is an example of the Sun traveling as it moves around the Milky Way Galaxy!

https://youtu.be/0jHsq36_NTU

Next, you need to understand the concept of Barycenter! It takes 29yrs for Saturn to go around our Sun! It take 12yrs for Jupiter to go around the Sun!

Both gas giants pull on the Sun causing a wobble as it travels around our Milky Way Galaxy.

This wobble allows the Sun to move closer to the Goldilocks Zone where the earth travels around the Sun!

As the Sun moves closer to this Goldilocks Zone, it causes the planet to increase in temperature, thus you have Global Warming!

We can see this effect every 12 to 13 years due to Jupiter pulling on the Sun. But some times the temperature last longer than 12 to 13 years.

This longer temperature is due to Saturn aligning with Jupiter. This is all due to Barycenter. Here’s a video to help you understand Barycenter!

https://youtu.be/0jHsq36_NT
snippet.textOriginal:
To understand Climate Change, one needs to first understand what causes Climate Change.  

They say it’s because of CO2.  But, all first graders are all taught that plants need CO2 to survive.  Plants take this CO2 and converts it into Oxygen!  If you stop CO2, you cancel the production of Oxygen!

Second, one needs to understand how the moon effects out oceans.  We all know that the moon causes high tides and low tides. The moon gravity, pulls on our oceans causing these changes.

Next. The Sun is moving in space at 537, 000 Miles Per Hour!  Here is an example of the Sun traveling as it moves around the Milky Way Galaxy! 

https://youtu.be/0jHsq36_NTU

Next, you need to understand the concept of Barycenter!  It takes 29yrs for Saturn to go around our Sun!  It take 12yrs for Jupiter to go around the Sun! 

Both gas giants pull on the Sun causing a wobble as it travels around our Milky Way Galaxy. 

This wobble allows the Sun to move closer to the  Goldilocks Zone where the earth travels around the Sun!

As the Sun moves closer to this Goldilocks Zone, it causes the planet to increase in temperature, thus you have Global Warming!

We can see this effect every 12 to 13 years due to Jupiter pulling on the Sun.  But some times the temperature last longer than 12 to 13 years.

This longer temperature is due to Saturn aligning with Jupiter.  This is all due to Barycenter.  Here’s a video to help you understand Barycenter!

https://youtu.be/0jHsq36_NT
